title: Detection
description: Detection describes details about how, when, and by whom the incident was detected. An incident may have only one detection entity.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "detection--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

first_detected.description: The date and time the victim organization first became aware of the incident

who_detected.description: The individual entities or team(s) that first detected the incident

detected_method.description: The system or process that led to the first detection of the incident

logs.description: The type(s) of logs used by the detection team and/or method used to first detect the incident

comment.description: Clarifying comments about who, what, when, or how the incident was detected

anyOf.title: Law Enforcement
anyOf.description: Law enforcement discovered the insider's illegal activity (e.g., police noticed that the insider was gaining access to the company after hours)

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: The victim organization discovered the insider's activity (e.g., IT noticed that the insider had downloaded dozens of company trade secrets to their workstation)

anyOf.title: Customer
anyOf.description: A customer of the victim organization discovered the insider's activity

anyOf.title: Competitor
anyOf.description: An organization competing with the victim organization discovered the insider's activity (e.g., the insider approached a competing organization with company trade secrets, and the competitor alerted the victim organization)

anyOf.title: Auditor
anyOf.description: Internal or external auditor assigned to assess the organization's security, risk, or threat posture

anyOf.title: Self-Reported
anyOf.description: The insider reported their activity to their organization

anyOf.title: Incident Response Team
anyOf.description: The incident response team (IRT) discovered the insider's activity

anyOf.title: Security Team
anyOf.description: Technical or personnel security team discovered the insider's activity

anyOf.title: Management
anyOf.description: A member of the organization's management or the insider's management chain discovered the insider's activities

anyOf.title: Internal Investigators
anyOf.description: Investigators internal to the victim organization

anyOf.title: Researcher
anyOf.description: Researcher external to the organization

anyOf.title: Audit
anyOf.description: The insider's activity was spotted during an internal or third-party auditing process

anyOf.title: Technical Means
anyOf.description: The insider's activity was detected via analysis or anomalies in technical systems and software

anyOf.title: Non-Technical Means
anyOf.description: The insider's activity was detected in a non-technical fashion (e.g., the insider had personal items purchased with a company credit card sent to the office by accident)

anyOf.title: Security Software
anyOf.description: The insider's activity was detected by security software (e.g., the insider tried to download a document with trade secrets and an automatic alert detected the download)

anyOf.title: System Failure
anyOf.description: The insider's activity resulted in a system going down within the organization, which led to the detection of the insider's activities

anyOf.title: Access Logs
anyOf.description: File or system access logs

anyOf.title: Audit Logs
anyOf.description: Logs generated specifically for auditing purposes

anyOf.title: Bank Records
anyOf.description: Financial transaction or account records

anyOf.title: Database Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from traditional or non-traditional database servers or services

anyOf.title: Email Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from email servers or services

anyOf.title: Financial Statements
anyOf.description: Statements or records from an individual's financial account(s)

anyOf.title: ISP Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from internet service providers (ISPs)

anyOf.title: Remote Access Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from remote access servers or clients

anyOf.title: System File Logs
anyOf.description: File logs (create, delete, modify, etc.) from workstations, servers, and other systems

anyOf.title: Video Logs
anyOf.description: Video, security cam, webcam, screen capture recordings

anyOf.title: Web Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from web servers or web proxies
